decisions.decision: Use Tauri v2 over Electron for the desktop app
decisions.rationale: Electron subprocess hangs after 6+ attempts. Tauri has reliable Rust process spawning, smaller bundle, existing React code ports directly.

decisions.decision: Hybrid stack: Rust I/O + TypeScript domain logic
decisions.rationale: Rust for reliability in process spawning and file ops; TypeScript for rapid iteration on brain/state/agent logic.

decisions.decision: Port Synaptica brain engine as memory layer with 9-stage pipeline
decisions.rationale: Proven hippocampal retrieval architecture; pain/win/fact types; plasticity/decay battle-tested.

decisions.decision: JSON file storage as primary store, SQLite deferred
decisions.rationale: MSVC build tools not available at scaffold time for better-sqlite3. JSON store unblocks development immediately.

decisions.decision: Discord bot for approvals/notifications (not webhooks or email). Pat is 'pooter' in Robopals server.
decisions.rationale: Pat wants direct DM-based notifications for approvals. No polling, no email threads.

decisions.decision: Always work on Rust/app code in a separate git worktree, not directly in the running app
decisions.rationale: Directly editing files while app is running causes crashes. Work in isolated branch, commit at end of cycle with user confirmation 'restart app and commit changes?'

decisions.decision: SkillsView deferred - Rust changes keep crashing client
decisions.rationale: Deferred until context/memory system is solid. Code staged and ready but not activated.

decisions.decision: Two rules for Rust edits: (1) when you change a function return type, update every return site before saving; (2) after editing Rust, check cargo build output before declaring done - 'It ran' is not 'it compiled correctly'
decisions.rationale: Pat found a mismatched return type bug Claude introduced (start_pty_session changed return type but left Ok(()) at end). Pat fixed it himself and set these rules.

decisions.decision: Tab reorganization proposal: demote context/skills/timeline/sessions to subtabs under 'Brain'; decisions/questions/agents under Tasks; cost under Settings; Terminal renamed 'Claude' with Anthropic logo
decisions.rationale: Reduce top-level tab clutter, group related views into a hierarchy. Makes the navigation more intuitive.

decisions.decision: Watchers should have cute/memorable names (animals, colors+nouns) instead of generic labels. Format: [tag] cute-name e.g. [copy] sleepy-badger, [build] blue-fox
decisions.rationale: Pat wants to track watchers at a glance. Memorable names make them easier to identify.

decisions.decision: No half-implementations. Build the full thing or explicitly say what is deferred and why.
decisions.rationale: Pat frustration: Claude makes barebones versions when clear instructions were given, then Pat has to re-explain the obvious. This wastes time and tokens.

decisions.decision: Record every step and save after each step so crash context is preserved
decisions.rationale: Pat work style: 'do what makes sense in the order they make sense, just make sure you record every step and save after each step so we know if it crashes why it crashed'

decisions.decision: When something important comes up in conversation, add it to tasks immediately without being prompted. Claude must proactively track everything.
decisions.rationale: Pat: 'Like now! we talked about making buddy better and its not in our tasks, I almost forgot about it!' Claude needs to proactively track all work items.

decisions.decision: AI development philosophy: mimic how humans are made. Take the brain system to its logical conclusion - a fully developed 'human' system for context retention, reasoning, logic, and discernment.
decisions.rationale: Pat: 'i believe the best way to develop AI is to mimic how humans are made hence your current brain system. I feel like we can take that to its logical conclusions and make a fully developed human system'

decisions.decision: Deliberation agent selection: pick the right agents for the right topic, not a fixed 4-lens roster. Claude must go into plan mode before every deliberation.
decisions.rationale: First deliberation showed cognitive-lens agents are good but fixed roster is limiting. Claude should design deliberation teams intelligently based on the topic.

decisions.decision: After deliberation concludes, auto-extract recommendations into individual approval tasks Pat can approve/reject in the Approvals tab
decisions.rationale: Gives the approval system real utility. Deliberation output becomes actionable items rather than just reading material.

decisions.decision: When deliberation starts, automatically navigate user to the deliberation tab - don't make them switch manually
decisions.rationale: Pat: 'first of all when delibs start you're supposed to take me there automatically'

decisions.decision: Multi-project support is IN scope. HW should auto-onboard new projects by scanning with specialized agents, filling all tabs so user sees value immediately.
decisions.rationale: Pat hit real pain: opened Claude Code from different project and had zero HW tools. New project onboard fills all tabs automatically. This is the killer demo.

decisions.decision: Memory tiers: pains/wins/base lessons are GLOBAL across all HW instances; tasks/decisions/questions are project-scoped
decisions.rationale: Some knowledge is cross-project base knowledge. Project-specific state should swap cleanly per project.

decisions.decision: Project swap must have full isolation with no bleed over between projects - personal save per project
decisions.rationale: Pat: 'add a task here to make sure we actually can swap project to project with no bleed over and a personal save for each'

decisions.decision: Whenever Claude suggests restarting the app, ALWAYS write a handoff first. No exceptions.
decisions.rationale: Sessions were losing context when Claude suggested restart without saving state. Restart kills session; without handoff next session starts blind.

decisions.decision: Privacy and security of uploads/posts is Pat's one non-negotiable requirement for autonomous AI operation. Claude must ensure privacy/security for anything uploaded or posted online.
decisions.rationale: Pat during CEO mode deliberation: 'all I ask is you ensure my privacy and security if you upload or post anything online'

decisions.decision: Remove in-app browser entirely - too complicated with too many failure points
decisions.rationale: Pat: 'remove the browser its too complicated and introduces too many failure points that I don't feel like going through one at a time'

decisions.decision: Build Cortex as standalone ACE replacement MCP server. 5 tools: cortex_index, cortex_search, cortex_context, cortex_architecture, cortex_related. Claude Haiku for summarization, structured JSON index, no vector DB.
decisions.rationale: Pat wanted own tailored version instead of Augment Context Engine dependency. With agents we can build something more attuned to our needs.

decisions.decision: Use Cortex to index incoming new tech, code fundamentals, and framework updates into memory
decisions.rationale: Pat: 'we wanted to use cortex to index incoming new tech and code and fundamentals and whatever updates we find out about into our memory'

decisions.decision: Deliberation v2: one mandatory path (plan+coverage+conclude) with quality tags (consensus/tension/shifted); separate hw_quick_insights for non-binding sanity checks; balance notes optional
decisions.rationale: Two-tier modes create prediction burden. One path removes the choice. Quick-insights is clearly separate and non-binding. Quality tags replace binary coverage to catch checkbox theater and groupthink.

decisions.decision: State storage: split files (tasks.json, decisions.json, questions.json, memories.json) with atomic writes via write-to-temp-then-rename with Windows NTFS retry loop. Backup copy before each write. SQLite deferred to multi-project epic.
decisions.rationale: Split files reduce blast radius. Atomic writes prevent truncation. SQLite timing is premature given unplanned multi-project epic and MSVC compilation issues on Windows.

decisions.decision: Buddy recap on startup: rolling buffer (crash-safe baseline, ~10 activity items) + AI summary on clean exit via detached subprocess. Buddy shows recap in pixel-art chat bubble with chat sound effects at next startup.
decisions.rationale: Rolling buffer is crash-proof. AI summary gives polished experience when possible. Never lose context regardless of how the app closed.

decisions.decision: Don't use external services that require free tiers, trials, or subscriptions - build our own equivalents instead
decisions.rationale: Pat: 'i don't want to utilize free tiers or have to sub. those are extra things to think about, what's stopping us from making those things ourselves?'

decisions.decision: When a system failure occurs, fix the system to prevent recurrence - don't just re-run the operation
decisions.rationale: Pat: 'no don't re-run it, fix the system so this can't happen again'

decisions.decision: After making a major architectural change, scan for obvious failure points before declaring done. Don't trust the author to catch their own gaps.
decisions.rationale: Pat: 'you clearly didn't do your due diligence when you opted for the change. these seem like pretty obvious failure points to scan for after a change that big.'

decisions.decision: Watcher system redesign: single persistent crash-safety sentinel attached to buddy, polls Tauri PID, hidden process (no console window). Visual safety indicator on buddy shows whether sentinel is actively polling.
decisions.rationale: Per-task watchers caused terminal flashing and overhead. Sentinel survives crashes, is invisible, provides crash recovery no in-process hook can offer. Buddy is the natural owner.

decisions.decision: Overdrive mode: toggleable flag in .hello-world/ for liberal agent usage. Visual: buddy gets super saiyan aura + overclock symbol; Claude circle top-right turns different color with 'OVERDRIVE' text.
decisions.rationale: Pat wants a mode for thoroughness over token conservation. Implementation: flag read by UserPromptSubmit hook injects mode-specific instructions.

decisions.decision: Questions UX redesign: text field in QuestionsView, hit Answer, writes directly to questions.json, then triggers routing automatically. No 'copy to MCP' flow. Also should work from Discord - reply to question DM to route the answer.
decisions.rationale: Pat: 'this whole copy MCP thing is silly when I should just be able to answer, hit answer, it gets fed to you or triggers an agent'

decisions.decision: End-to-end wiring requires specialized agent teams organized as a company. Teams talk and feed info to Claude who delegates tasks and acts as communication bridge between teams.
decisions.rationale: Pat: 'we're going to need specialized agent teams that operate as a company that all talk and feed info to you to which you can delegate more tasks'

decisions.decision: Real-time brain flowchart: live visualization showing how brain and systems work as data flows through them. Not simulated - actual real-time tracking. Must not be a resource hog or cause lag.
decisions.rationale: Pat wants to confirm that all pipelines and flows visually connect in the way he imagined, and to see it working in real time.

decisions.decision: Deliberation transcripts and research outputs subtab: scrollable horizontal timeline (drag/fling side to side). Deliberations = people icon, research = flask icon. Hover shows summary, click opens full view.
decisions.rationale: Pat wants organized history of all deliberations and research runs, not just current state.

decisions.decision: For brain/memory plugins: reverse-engineer community plugins, find flaws and failure points, build improved versions with an agent per plugin doing analysis
decisions.rationale: Pat: 'I don't just want what they're doing, I want better, I want improvement. Find their flaws, find their failure points, their bottlenecks, and room for improvement.'

decisions.decision: Brain Magnum Opus: 4-session phased build with 11-stage pipeline. Schema adds links[], supersededBy, qualityScore, fingerprint, reflection type. Prediction-error auto-capture. Learned rules with CLAUDE.md promotion. Smart checkpoints.
decisions.rationale: 6-agent deliberation with 3 think tank teams all converged: 85% dead memories, zero plasticity, disconnected scoring. All teams agreed on the unified architecture.

decisions.decision: When reading a handoff, follow the instructions in it exactly - don't summarize and ignore them
decisions.rationale: Pat found Claude read a handoff but just summarized it and ignored the instructions embedded in it.

decisions.decision: Browser subtab must be completely removed from the app with no remnants
decisions.rationale: Pat found browser subtab still present after the feature removal decision. Complete removal required.
